profile_positions.description:
Researcher Nationaal Vergiftigingen Informatie Centrum (Dutch Poisons Information Center), trained toxicologist (European Registered). Fields of interest:
-Industrial Chemicals
-Household Chemicals
-CBRN
-Paracetamol intoxications
-Trend analysis of intoxications

Responsibilities:
-Write/update monographs on chemicals/drugs (www.vergiftigingen.info)
-Chair knowledge/workinggroups
-Literature research
-Follow-up research
-Inform medical professionals about acute intoxications (risk assessment and treatment options)
-Publish in peer-reviewed clinical toxicological journals
-Education (train students and lecture)
profile_positions.title: Researcher/Toxicologist (ERT)

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: Continuation of the research I started at the department of Metabolic Diseases, in the group of Dr. Kalkhoven, appointment as a permanent researcher. I studied the process of adipogenesis, with a focus on the role of PPARgamma. My research focussed on the interaction between PPARgamma and coregulators, modifications (phosphorylation, ubiquitination) of PPARgamma and effects of certain mutations in PPARgamma which are found in patients suffering from familial partial lipodystrophy type 3 (FPLD3). Tasks also included supervising students, PhD students and teaching cell biology to medical students.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: The  "Crisis Expert Team - milieu en drinkwater" is a "knowledge-based network" of eight institutes (RIMV-MOD/NVIC/CEAG/LIOGS/KWR/WFSR/NVIC/WMCN/LCM) that can provide information about risk assessment and measures to be taken in the event of incidents involving hazardous substances. As a procesmanager within the CET-md, I am responsible for coordinating the information exchange between the various institutes affiliated with the CET-md in the warm phase of an incident. A well-coordinated and streamlined collection of information contributes to the formation of unambiguous advice to the security region.
profile_positions.title: Procesmanager Crisis Expert Team milieu en drinkwater

profile_positions.description: At the department of Metabolic Diseases, in the group of Dr. Kalkhoven, I studied the process of adipogenesis, with a focus on the role of PPARgamma. My research focussed on the interaction between PPARgamma and coregulators, modifications (phosphorylation, ubiquitination) of PPARgamma and effects of certain mutations in PPARgamma which are found in patients suffering from familial partial lipodystrophy type 3 (FPLD3). Tasks also included supervising students, PhD students and teaching cell biology to medical students.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral researcher

profile_positions.description: The study of the role of the transcription factor MYCN in neuroblastoma tumorigenesis. During my PhD, under supervision of Dr. Valentijn and prof. Dr. Versteeg, I tried to elucidate the regulatory pathway of MYCN by identification of new transcriptional targets of MYCN. Targets include genes encoding proteins involved in the WNT pathway and cell cycle regulatory proteins. I defended my thesis the 23rd of March, 2008.
profile_positions.title: PhD student

profile_positions.description: Teaching Chemistry and Physics to highschool students (havo/vwo)
profile_positions.title: Chemistry/physics teacher
